intro: Oncerum acaule, commonly known as the naked-stem Oncerum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a water-holding cup at the center. Its inflorescence consists of a cluster of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Oncerum acaule is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flowering habit.
